thread.title: EastEnders viewers share outrage as soap airs ‘Poles Go Home’ racism storyline – but writer insists it’s a ‘real issue’ as he hits back at backlash
thread.title_full: EastEnders viewers share outrage as soap airs ‘Poles Go Home’ racism storyline – but writer insists it’s a ‘real issue’ as he hits back at backlash

author: ballcock
title: EastEnders viewers share outrage as soap airs ‘Poles Go Home’ racism storyline – but writer insists it’s a ‘real issue’ as he hits back at backlash
text:
— John Moran (@Noncompos) February 21, 2017 related stories Former EastEnders star Shaun Williamson insists Danny Dyer is under 'pressure' Forget something? Kate Moss enjoys a night out... but leaves her bra at home 'I THOUGHT THIS IS IT' Loose Women's Martine McCutcheon reveals terrifying moment she was grabbed by car of men PRICE'S HUBBY We take a look at Kieran Hayler - Katie Price's cheating husband who had affairs with Jane Pountney and Chrissy Thomas SHE'S BACK! Here's all you need to know about Mary Berry's next BBC cooking extravaganza WHAT'S IN THE BAGS, MEG? Megan McKenna accused of PRETENDING she can afford to buy designer goods by fans FLIRTY FLANAGAN Coronation Street beauty Helen Flanagan shows off toned legs in short skirt and stilettos FAMILY DRAMA Channel 4's The Royal House of Windsor explores past 100 years of the famous dynasty it's Actually happening Find out who’s returning for the mini-sequel to Love Actually – and when you can see it GROWING FAMILY Here's what we know about the latest additions to Madonna's brood - twins Stella and Esther WHO'S THAT GIRL? Lewis Bloor has cheated on Marnie Simpson with Bristol girl Amelia Guest - here's the lowdown DADDY'S HOME Jeremy McConnell sets up home in Liverpool with Stephanie Davis and newborn Caben-Albi and has 'no intention of returning to Dublin' Denise was curious as to what was going on 
Yet screenwriter Leo took time to reply to a few accusatory comments. 
In reply to a Twitter user who called for him to lose his job he quizzed: “So are you saying that racism doesn't exist? And that this isn't a very real problem in Britain today?” 
Another posted: "It's the Britain we live in now" - very low, please do not write for this soap again.” 
Leo again replied: “What you saw on screen was a fictional character expressing his own belief. The side of a under represented group of people, I might add." 
A spokesperson for EastEnders told The Sun Online they would not be issuing a comment. EastEnders airs Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday nights on BBC One
